page.title: 10EDUCATION_WESTWOOD'S GRAMMAR
page.content: Westwood's Grammar School has been in existence for 400 years. There are 313 pupils including a lower and upper sixth. The small size ofthe school is considered special and successful, as the 'O' level pass rate is 20% over the national average. 17 subjects are taught at 'O' level and 12 at 'A' level. There are 20 full_time teachers and 2 part_time _17 people keep the school going, groundsmen etc. 13 rooms are used at the school. At Westwoods there are 3 houses, Westwoods, Bradley and Rixon. These houses compete in sports day, a drama competition, pop quiz and a technology competition. Recently,"Smike" was performed which was very successful. Proposals have been put forward to amalgamate Westwoods with Bourton secondary school, though nothing will be decided until November.
